snippet: By teaming up with Betterment, Fidelity hopes to give the nearly 3,000 registered investment advisers who store client money at the firm the ability to serve customers with smaller balances.
abstract: Fidelity Investments announces plan to team up with Betterment to encourage Fidelity-affiliated financial advisers to use its service; Betterment is part of a fast-growing group of software companies that put customers in index funds and that manage their portfolios for a relatively low cost; unusual investment in a potential competitor shows Fidelity's awareness of new trends in low-net-worth market.
lead_paragraph: By teaming up with Betterment, Fidelity hopes to give the nearly 3,000 registered investment advisers who store client money at the firm the ability to serve customers with smaller balances.

headline.main: Fidelity Investments Forges Alliance With Low-Cost Player
headline.print_headline: Fidelity Forges Alliance With Low-Cost Player
